text: It is a bit annoying that automatic merging of patch releases for packages suddenly stopped working because of the license check. I have deadlines and wanted to do version bumps as usual, but it suddenly became much more work which was not anticipated.

elements.text: It is a bit annoying that automatic merging of patch releases for packages suddenly stopped working because of the license check. I have deadlines and wanted to do version bumps as usual, but it suddenly became much more work which was not anticipated.

text: Sorry to hear that. It should just be a matter of adding any OSI license (GPL, MIT, etc) and re-triggering registration.

elements.text: Sorry to hear that. It should just be a matter of adding any OSI license (GPL, MIT, etc) and re-triggering registration.

text: Yes, but first I have to discuss the license with the collaborators :smile:

elements.text: Yes, but first I have to discuss the license with the collaborators

text: Ah, that can slow things down for sure...

elements.text: Ah, that can slow things down for sure...

text: But on the other side it is good to (finally) have this discussion hehe

elements.text: But on the other side it is good to (finally) have this discussion hehe

text: Would it help next time if we made a discourse announcement a few days or a week beforehand? Or some other way to let everyone know ahead of time so they can take it into account in their schedules better?

elements.text: Would it help next time if we made a discourse announcement a few days or a week beforehand? Or some other way to let everyone know ahead of time so they can take it into account in their schedules better?

text:
I think if this is an issue, it is reasonable to ask for a manual merge while you work it out, with a promise that you will sort it out within e.g. 2 weeks.
Esp if the question is not "open source y/n?" but "which license?"

root.text: It is a bit annoying that automatic merging of patch releases for packages suddenly stopped working because of the license check. I have deadlines and wanted to do version bumps as usual, but it suddenly became much more work which was not anticipated.

elements.text: It is a bit annoying that automatic merging of patch releases for packages suddenly stopped working because of the license check. I have deadlines and wanted to do version bumps as usual, but it suddenly became much more work which was not anticipated.

I think if this is an issue, it is reasonable to ask for a manual merge while you work it out, with a promise that you will sort it out within e.g. 2 weeks.
Esp if the question is not "open source y/n?" but "which license?"

text: Yes, I know I could have asked for a manual merge, but I don't wanted you to set a precedent.

elements.text: Yes, I know I could have asked for a manual merge, but I don't wanted you to set a precedent.

text: I think a discoure announcement would be a good idea if there are changes to the automatic merging or the merging guidelines in general.

elements.text: I think a discoure announcement would be a good idea if there are changes to the automatic merging or the merging guidelines in general.
